util
Class InterruptableProgressDialog

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Dialog
                  javax.swing.JDialog
                      util.EscapeDialog
                          util.InterruptableProgressDialog
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
LatexPrerenderer
public abstract class InterruptableProgressDialog
extends EscapeDialog
implements java.lang.Runnable

A dialog box with a label, a progress bar and a cancel button. It implements the Runnable interface. The code which performs the operations whose progress has to be displayed can reside in the run() method. Thus the whole dialog box can be run as a thread. The progress bar has to be updated manually. If the user chooses to cancel the process, the interrupt() method will be called and your code has to react appropriately.

Author:
Lenko Grigorov
See Also:
run(), progressBar, interrupt(), Serialized Form

onEscapeEvent

protected void onEscapeEvent()
Called when the user presses the Escape key. Calls interrupt().

Overrides:
onEscapeEvent in class EscapeDialog
See Also:
interrupt()

interrupt

public abstract void interrupt()
Called when the user chooses to interrupt the process.

Place here the code that will halt the progress of your process.

See Also:
run()

run

public abstract void run()
Called to trigger the activities whose progress will be displayed.

Place here the code which performs the activities whose progress is displayed.

You have to manually update the progress bar.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
See Also:
progressBar, interrupt()
